questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE about default constructor?
options: It must always be defined by the programmer
It is automatically generated if no constructor is provided
It initializes all members to zero

questions.question: Which statement about object slicing is TRUE?
options: Occurs when derived object is passed by reference
Occurs when derived object is assigned to base class object by value

questions.question: Which operation is illegal on pointers?
What does the override keyword ensure?
options: Function hides a base class method
Function must override a virtual function

questions.question: Which C++ feature enables separating interface from implementation?
Which destructor property is TRUE for a class with virtual functions?
options: Destructor must be virtual to avoid memory leak

questions.question: Which operator is used internally to build the vtable structure?
options: It is compiler generated, not an operator

questions.question: Which of the following causes memory corruption?
Which situation requires move constructor?
Which C++ technique allows multiple base classes?
What happens if a pure virtual destructor is declared?
options: Objects cannot be created using pointers

questions.question: Which cast removes constness from a variable?
Which of the following is TRUE for templates?
Which of the following can be overloaded?
What is the output? int x = 5; cout << (++x + x++);
Which access specifier allows member access only to derived classes?
Which data structure is used internally by std::map?
Which C++ construct supports resource cleanup automatically?
Which container allows constant-time insertion at both ends?
Which feature ensures function binding happens during runtime?
